summary.para: Indicates whether a generic operation should continue.

returns.para: This method can return the following values.

description.para: Cancel the operation as soon as possible.

summary.para: Indicates whether a lengthy printing operation should continue.

param.name: nCntPrinted
param.para: The total number of pages that have been printed at the time the object receives a call to FContinuePrinting.

param.name: nCurPage
param.para: The page number of the page being printed at the time the object receives a call to FContinuePrinting.

param.name: pwszPrintStatus
param.para: A pointer to the message about the current status of the print job. The object being printed may or may not display this message to the user. This parameter can be NULL.

returns.para: This method can return the standard return value E_UNEXPECTED, as well as the following values.

description.para: Cancel the printing operation as soon as possible.

remarks.para: Implementations of call this method at periodic intervals during the printing process. The implementation should call back at least after printing each page, so that its client can, if necessary, display useful visual feedback to the user. IPrint.Print can call back multiple times with the same nCntPrinted and nCurPage values, which is sometimes useful when a page being printed is complex and it is appropriate to give a user an opportunity to cancel in mid-page.

summary.para: Provides a generic callback mechanism for interruptible processes that should periodically ask an object whether to continue.
The method is a generic continuation request. carries extra information pertaining to a printing process and is used in the context of .
